Documentation¶

The sampler object¶

racecar.sampler¶

alias of racecar.sampler.Sampler

A class containing the state information for the current sampler object.

sample(Nsteps, printnum=None, thin=1, output=["pos"]):

Runs the sampler and returns the trajectory

sample(Nsteps, printnum=None, thin=1, output=['pos'])¶

Runs the sampler and returns a trajectory.

Parameters

  • Nsteps (int) – the number of steps to take.

  • printnum (int, optional) – if given, prints a summary of the sampling _printnum_ times

  • thin (int, optional) – thins the trajectory by only including one of each _thin_ points

  • output (list, optional) – a list of strings giving which arrays should be returned by the function.

Returns

  • Q (numpy array) – the trajectory array for sampled points

  • P (numpy array) – the sampled momentum points (if applicable)

  • LLH (numpy array) – the log likelihood of sampled points

  • XI (numpy array) – the sampled auxillary variables (if applicable)

  • F (numpy array) – the gradient of the log likelihood function at each sampled point (if applicable)

The llh module¶

Contains examples of functions for a variety of standard likelihoods.

racecar.llh.blr(q, XX, tt, idxs=None)¶

BLR

racecar.llh.isotropic_gaussian(q)¶

Iso Gaussian
